abstract: The 2,000 or so Tibetan Buddhist monks of Kirti Monastery in China's Sichuan Province are at the center of one of the biggest waves of self-immolations in modern history. The acts evoke the self-immolations in the early 1960s by Buddhist monks in South Vietnam.

headline.main: In an Occupied Tibetan Monastery, a Reason for So Many Fiery Deaths
